DOC.brief_summary: The primary aim study : 1 ) Establish concurrent criterion-related validity four traumatic brain injury ( TBI ) screen question ( TBI-4 ) use Ohio State University TBI Identification Method ( OSU TBI-ID ) 2 ) Establish concurrent criterion-related validity TBI-4 addition detail information elicit four question . Secondary aim include : 1 ) Determining addition detail information elicit TBI-4 result increase specificity ; 2 ) Determining whether prevalence traumatic brain injury ( TBI ) sample concordant previous research ; 3 ) Determining whether psychiatric outcome bad veteran traumatic brain injury ( TBI ) traumatic brain injury ( TBI ) . Primary Hypotheses : Hypothesis 1a : The sensitivity specificity TBI-4 significantly great 0.75 0.80 , respectively . Hypothesis 1b : The sensitivity specificity TBI-4 addition detail information elicit question ( i.e. , free text information enter clinician administer TBI-4 ) significantly great 0.75 0.80 , respectively . Secondary Hypotheses : Hypothesis 1c : The specificity TBI-4 addition detail information elicit question ( i.e. , free text information enter clinician administer TBI-4 ) significantly great four question alone . Hypothesis 2 : A significant difference psychiatric outcome ( psychiatric hospitalization , suicidal ideation , suicide attempt completion , mental health-related contact ) identify history TBI versus without history TBI determine , first , TBI-4 , second , OSU TBI-ID . Hypothesis 3 : The prevalence Traumatic Brain Injury- Loss Consciousness ( TBI-LOC ) population similar identify Walker et al1 ( 31.7 % individual report 1 TBI-LOC ) .
DOC.brief_title: Use Traumatic Brain Injury ( TBI ) Screen Veteran Mental Health Population
DOC.criteria: Veteran must least 18 year age . Veteran must mental health intake earlier January 2007 . Failure provide inform consent evidence inability respond state question . No Mental Health Intake note medical record . Presence Mental Health Intake note computer contain TBI4
